doc.title: South Korea: BOK—On Hold As Expected With Dovish Guidance
doc.source_uri: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS/South Korea BOKOn Hold As Expected With Dovish Guidance South Korea BOKOn Hold As Expected With Dovish Guidance_2025-08-28

processing_metadata.publication: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS
processing_metadata.input_relative_path: 25.9月 普通个人版/9.1 普通个人版/GS

passages.text: The Bank of Korea's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept its policy rate unchanged at \(2.5\%\) , in line with expectations. One MPC member cast a dissenting vote calling for a cut to \(2.25\%\) , for the first time since April. MPC forward guidance also turned more dovish, with 5 out of 6 members (up from 4 in the previous meeting) open to a further cut in the next three months. The BOK revised up its 2025 growth and headline CPI inflation forecast by 0.1pp each to \(0.9\%\) and \(2.0\%\) respectively. We continue to expect one more 25bp cut in October to \(2.25\%\) . Our baseline projection for the terminal rate remains at \(2.25\%\) , with the balance of risk tilted slightly to \(2.0\%\) .

1. The Bank of Korea's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) kept its policy rate unchanged at \(2.5\%\) , in line with Bloomberg consensus and our forecast. One MPC member (Mr. Shin) cast a dissenting vote calling for a cut to \(2.25\%\) , given meaningful progress in financial stability perspective (i.e. slowdown in household debt growth and housing price inflation). This marked the first dissent since April, which was followed by a 25bp cut in May.

2. The BOK raised its real GDP growth forecast for 2025 by 0.1pp to \(0.9\%\) (vs. Bloomberg consensus: \(1.0\%\) ; GS forecast: \(1.2\%\) ), while keeping its forecast for 2026 unchanged at \(1.6\%\) (Exhibit 2). During the press conference, the BOK Governor explained that the stronger-than-expected consumption and exports added \(+0.2\) pp each to the headline GDP growth forecast, while weaker-than-expected construction shaved the headline figure by \(0.3\) pp.

3. The central bank raised its headline inflation forecasts for 2025 and 2026 by 0.1pp each to \(2.0\%\) (Bloomberg consensus: \(2.0\%\) ; GS forecast: \(1.9\%\) ) and \(1.9\%\) respectively (Exhibit 3). Core inflation forecast for 2025 remained unchanged at \(1.9\%\) while that for 2026 was revised up to \(1.9\%\) from \(1.8\%\) before. Overall, the Governor assessed that fresh food prices posed slight upward pressure to headline CPI inflation but core inflation will likely stay stable on moderate demand side pressure with a large negative output gap.
4. The forward-looking section of the MPC statement kept the key wording that "the MPC will maintain its rate cut stance to mitigate downside risks to economic growth".
5. The MPC composition on near-term guidance turned even more dovish, with 5

Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. For Reg AC certification and other important disclosures, see the Disclosure Appendix, or go to www.gs.com/research/hedge.html.

out of 6 members staying open to a further cut in the next three months, up from 4 members in the previous meeting (Exhibit 1). According to the Governor, the one minority member's view was that it may require more than 3 months for financial stability risks to be addressed.

6. On future policy decisions, the Governor commented that the MPC may keep an easing stance through 1H of next year, under the condition that growth moves in line with the central bank's current projections. The negative output gap was currently estimated at around \(1\%\) of GDP and is expected to stay substantial before starting to narrow in 2H of 2026. As for the impact of the 100bp rate cuts already delivered since start of this easing cycle, the Governor explained that statistically, a 25bp rate cut boosts growth by 0.06pp.

7. In response to a question on whether there are specific levels of Seoul housing price inflation that would allow for BOK easing, the Governor reiterated previous comments that the MPC does not aim to control housing prices through policy rate changes. That said, the MPC closely monitors housing prices given their close correlation with household debt growth. Also, given a need for coordination with broader government policies, the MPC aims to adjust the timing of the next policy rate cut so that it does not offset the impact of the government's recent housing market stabilization measures. Furthermore, the MPC will continue to take a holistic assessment including a review of current housing inflation relative to historic average, risks of acceleration and whether the housing inflation is broadening from Seoul to other regions.

8. We maintain our expectation for one more 25bp cut in October, bringing the policy rate down to \(2.25\%\) . Several factors will influence the pace and scale of additional monetary easing, including the decisions of the Federal Reserve, the state of the housing markets and household leverage, as well as fiscal policy. Our baseline projection for the terminal rate remains at \(2.25\%\) , with the balance of risk tilted slightly to \(2.0\%\) .
Exhibit 1: MPC forward guidance turns incrementally more dovish
Source:Bank of Korea,Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 2: BOK revised up its 2025 growth forecast by 0.1pp to \(0.9\%\)
Source:Bank of Korea,Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research
Exhibit 3: BOK raises headline inflation forecast by 0.1pp to \(2.0\%\) for 2025
Source:BankofKorea,GoldmanSachsGlobal InvestmentResearch

The views attributed to third party presenters at Goldman Sachs arranged conferences, including individuals from other parts of Goldman Sachs, do not necessarily reflect those of Global Investment Research and are not an official view of Goldman Sachs.

Any trading recommendation in this research relating to an equity or credit security or securities within an industry or sector is reflective of the investment theme being discussed and is not a recommendation of any such security in isolation.

This research is not an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy any security in any jurisdiction where such an offer or solicitation would be illegal. As an example, certain clients may request to receive notifications when research on specific securities is published, and certain clients may request that specific data underlying analysts' fundamental analysis available on our internal client websites be delivered to them electronically through data feeds or otherwise. No change to an analyst's fundamental research views (e.g., ratings, price targets, or material changes to earnings estimates for equity securities), will be communicated to any client prior to inclusion of such information in a research report broadly disseminated through electronic publication to our internal client websites or through other means, as necessary, to all clients who are entitled to receive such reports.

All research reports are disseminated and available to all clients simultaneously through electronic publication to our internal client websites. Not all research content is redistributed to our clients or available to third- party aggregators, nor is Goldman Sachs responsible for the redistribution of our research by third party aggregators. For research, models or other data related to one or more securities, markets or asset classes (including related services) that may be available to you, please contact your GS representative or go to https://research.gs.com.

figures.title: MPC composition on forward guidance (policy rate consideration in the near term)
